metadata.title: CVE-2023-52734 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:sched: sch: Bounds check priority Nothing was explicitly bounds checkingthe priority index used to access clpriop[]. WARN and bail out early ifit's pathological. Seen with GCC 13: ../net/sched/sch_htb.c: In function'htb_activate_prios': ../net/sched/sch_htb.c:437:44: warning: arraysubscript [0, 31] is outside array bounds of 'struct htb_prio[8]'[-Warray-bounds=] 437 | if (p->inner.clprio[prio].feed.rb_node) |~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~ ../net/sched/sch_htb.c:131:41: note: whilereferencing 'clprio' 131 | struct htb_prio clprio[TC_HTB_NUMPRIO]; | ^~~~~~

criterions.comment: linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
